Alerts

Bootstrap 5 alert components for academic notifications

  1. Dashboard
  2. Interface
  3. Alerts
Basic Alert Styles

Bootstrap 5 provides contextual alert messages for typical user actions.

Information: New student registration period has begun. Applications are now being accepted for the Fall 2024 semester.
Success: Student enrollment has been completed successfully. Welcome email has been sent to the student.
Warning: Course registration deadline is approaching. Only 3 days remaining for Fall 2024 enrollment.
Error: Unable to process payment. Please check payment information and try again.
Tip: Use advanced search filters to quickly find courses by department, professor, or schedule.
Security: Your account security settings have been updated successfully.
Dismissible Alerts
Congratulations! Your course "Advanced Mathematics" has been successfully published and is now available for student enrollment.
Reminder: Grade submission deadline for Fall 2024 is in 5 days. Please ensure all grades are submitted on time.
New Feature: The enhanced exam scheduling system is now live! Schedule and manage exams from your dashboard.
Academic Status Alerts
Student Enrollment Complete

Sarah Johnson has successfully enrolled in "Computer Science 101". Total enrolled students: 28/30.

Enrolled on October 15, 2024
Low Attendance Warning

Student ID: 2024001 has attendance below 75% in "Database Systems". Current attendance: 68%.

Last attendance: October 12, 2024
New Course Available

"Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals" is now available for enrollment. Prerequisites: Data Structures, Statistics.

Available starting Spring 2025
Payment Overdue

Student Michael Brown has an overdue payment of $2,500 for Fall 2024 tuition. Account will be suspended in 3 days.

Due date: October 1, 2024
Toast Notifications

Bootstrap 5 toast components for temporary notifications.

Alerts with Links
Schedule Update: The schedule for "Advanced Physics" has been modified. View updated schedule or contact the professor.
New study materials are available in the library. Browse resources or reserve books online.
